title: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: While writing SWT code in Build 204, I typed 'button.dispose'. At this point, I did not realize that the code assist list was up because I was not looking. There were 2 items in the list: 'DISPOSED' and 'intWidgetdispose()voidWidget'. I then typed '(' because the line I was typing was supposed to be 'button.dispose();'. But as soon as I typed '(', the automatic code assist inserted whatever was selected, which was 'DISPOSED'. This behavior is not what I expected.
OB: While writing SWT code, I type the following: button.dispose. At this point, I do not realize that the code assist list is up because I am not looking. There are 2 items in the list now: DISPOSED intWidgetdispose()voidWidget. I then type '(' because the line I was typing was supposed to be: button.dispose();. But as soon as I type the '(', then automatic code assist seems to insert whatever is selected.
EB: The automatic code assist should notice that I have typed a '(' and that this matches 'dispose()' far better than 'DISPOSED'. It should not automatically insert 'DISPOSED' in this case. Additionally, the code assist should be case sensitive when automatically inserting suggestions.
